trans-unit.source: The AdvancedPhotoCapture class allows you to capture High Dynamic Range (HDR) photos.
trans-unit.target: The AdvancedPhotoCapture class allows you to capture High Dynamic Range (HDR) photos.

trans-unit.source: High Dynamic Range (HDR) photo capture
trans-unit.target: High Dynamic Range (HDR) photo capture

trans-unit.source: High Dynamic Range (HDR) photo capture
trans-unit.target: High Dynamic Range (HDR) photo capture

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: The [**AdvancedPhotoCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181386) class allows you to capture High Dynamic Range (HDR) photos.
trans-unit.target: The [**AdvancedPhotoCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181386) class allows you to capture High Dynamic Range (HDR) photos.

trans-unit.source: This API also allows you to obtain a reference frame from the HDR capture before the processing of the final image is complete.
trans-unit.target: This API also allows you to obtain a reference frame from the HDR capture before the processing of the final image is complete.

trans-unit.source: Other articles related to HDR capture include:
trans-unit.target: Other articles related to HDR capture include:

trans-unit.source: You can use the [**SceneAnalysisEffect**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn948902) to allow the system to evaluate the content of the media capture preview stream to determine if HDR processing would improve the capture result.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [**SceneAnalysisEffect**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn948902) to allow the system to evaluate the content of the media capture preview stream to determine if HDR processing would improve the capture result.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Scene Analysis for Media Capture](scene-analysis-for-media-capture.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Scene Analysis for Media Capture](scene-analysis-for-media-capture.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the [**HdrVideoControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926680) to capture video using the Windows built-in HDR processing algorithm.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**HdrVideoControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926680) to capture video using the Windows built-in HDR processing algorithm.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Capture device controls for video capture](capture-device-controls-for-video-capture.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Capture device controls for video capture](capture-device-controls-for-video-capture.md).

trans-unit.source: You can use the [**VariablePhotoSequenceCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652564) to capture a sequence of photos, each with different capture settings, and implement your own HDR or other processing algorithm.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [**VariablePhotoSequenceCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652564) to capture a sequence of photos, each with different capture settings, and implement your own HDR or other processing algorithm.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Variable photo sequence](variable-photo-sequence.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Variable photo sequence](variable-photo-sequence.md).

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: Concurrently recording video and photo capture using **AdvancedPhotoCapture** is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Concurrently recording video and photo capture using **AdvancedPhotoCapture** is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Using the camera flash during advanced photo capture is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Using the camera flash during advanced photo capture is not supported.

trans-unit.source: **Note** This article builds on concepts and code discussed in [Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md), which describes the steps for implementing basic photo and video capture.
trans-unit.target: **Note** This article builds on concepts and code discussed in [Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md), which describes the steps for implementing basic photo and video capture.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you familiarize yourself with the basic media capture pattern in that article before moving on to more advanced capture scenarios.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you familiarize yourself with the basic media capture pattern in that article before moving on to more advanced capture scenarios.

trans-unit.source: The code in this article assumes that your app already has an instance of MediaCapture that has been properly initialized.
trans-unit.target: The code in this article assumes that your app already has an instance of MediaCapture that has been properly initialized.

trans-unit.source: HDR photo capture namespaces
trans-unit.target: HDR photo capture namespaces

trans-unit.source: To use HDR photo capture, your app must include the following namespaces in addition to the namespaces required for basic media capture.
trans-unit.target: To use HDR photo capture, your app must include the following namespaces in addition to the namespaces required for basic media capture.

trans-unit.source: HDRPhotoUsing
trans-unit.target: HDRPhotoUsing

trans-unit.source: Determine if HDR photo capture is supported on the current device
trans-unit.target: Determine if HDR photo capture is supported on the current device

trans-unit.source: The HDR capture technique described in this article is performed using the [**AdvancedPhotoCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181386) object.
trans-unit.target: The HDR capture technique described in this article is performed using the [**AdvancedPhotoCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181386) object.

trans-unit.source: Not all devices support HDR capture with **AdvancedPhotoCapture**.
trans-unit.target: Not all devices support HDR capture with **AdvancedPhotoCapture**.

trans-unit.source: Determine if the device on which your app is currently running supports the technique by getting the **MediaCapture** object's [**VideoDeviceController**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226825) and then getting the [**AdvancedPhotoControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt147840) property.
trans-unit.target: Determine if the device on which your app is currently running supports the technique by getting the **MediaCapture** object's [**VideoDeviceController**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226825) and then getting the [**AdvancedPhotoControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt147840) property.

trans-unit.source: Check the video device controller's [**SupportedModes**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt147844) collection to see if it includes [**AdvancedPhotoMode.Hdr**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt147845).
trans-unit.target: Check the video device controller's [**SupportedModes**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt147844) collection to see if it includes [**AdvancedPhotoMode.Hdr**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt147845).

trans-unit.source: If it does, HDR capture using **AdvancedPhotoCapture** is supported.
trans-unit.target: If it does, HDR capture using **AdvancedPhotoCapture** is supported.

trans-unit.source: HdrSupported
trans-unit.target: HdrSupported

trans-unit.source: Configure and prepare the AdvancedPhotoCapture object
trans-unit.target: Configure and prepare the AdvancedPhotoCapture object

trans-unit.source: Since you will need to access the [**AdvancedPhotoCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181386) instance from multiple places within your code, you should declare a member variable to hold the object.
trans-unit.target: Since you will need to access the [**AdvancedPhotoCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181386) instance from multiple places within your code, you should declare a member variable to hold the object.

trans-unit.source: DeclareAdvancedCapture
trans-unit.target: DeclareAdvancedCapture

trans-unit.source: In your app, after you have initialized the **MediaCapture** object, create an [**AdvancedPhotoCaptureSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt147837) object and set the mode to [**AdvancedPhotoMode.Hdr**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt147845).
trans-unit.target: In your app, after you have initialized the **MediaCapture** object, create an [**AdvancedPhotoCaptureSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt147837) object and set the mode to [**AdvancedPhotoMode.Hdr**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt147845).

trans-unit.source: Call the [**AdvancedPhotoControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt147840) object's [**Configure**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt147841) method, passing in the **AdvancedPhotoCaptureSettings** object you created.
trans-unit.target: Call the [**AdvancedPhotoControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt147840) object's [**Configure**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt147841) method, passing in the **AdvancedPhotoCaptureSettings** object you created.

trans-unit.source: Call the **MediaCapture** object's [**PrepareAdvancedPhotoCaptureAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181403), passing in an [**ImageEncodingProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700993) object specifying the type of encoding the capture should use.
trans-unit.target: Call the **MediaCapture** object's [**PrepareAdvancedPhotoCaptureAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181403), passing in an [**ImageEncodingProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700993) object specifying the type of encoding the capture should use.

trans-unit.source: The **ImageEncodingProperties** class provides static methods for creating the image encodings that are supported by **MediaCapture**.
trans-unit.target: The **ImageEncodingProperties** class provides static methods for creating the image encodings that are supported by **MediaCapture**.

trans-unit.source: **PrepareAdvancedPhotoCaptureAsync** returns the [**AdvancedPhotoCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181386) object you will use to initiate photo capture.
trans-unit.target: **PrepareAdvancedPhotoCaptureAsync** returns the [**AdvancedPhotoCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181386) object you will use to initiate photo capture.

trans-unit.source: You can use this object to register handlers for the [**OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181392) and [**AllPhotosCaptured**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181387) which are discussed later in this article.
trans-unit.target: You can use this object to register handlers for the [**OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181392) and [**AllPhotosCaptured**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181387) which are discussed later in this article.

trans-unit.source: CreateAdvancedCaptureAsync
trans-unit.target: CreateAdvancedCaptureAsync

trans-unit.source: Capture an HDR photo
trans-unit.target: Capture an HDR photo

trans-unit.source: Capture an HDR photo by calling the [**AdvancedPhotoCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181386) object's [**CaptureAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181388) method.
trans-unit.target: Capture an HDR photo by calling the [**AdvancedPhotoCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181386) object's [**CaptureAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181388) method.

trans-unit.source: This method returns a [**AdvancedCapturedPhoto**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181378) object that provides the captured photo in its [**Frame**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181382) property.
trans-unit.target: This method returns a [**AdvancedCapturedPhoto**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181378) object that provides the captured photo in its [**Frame**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181382) property.

trans-unit.source: CaptureHdrPhotoAsync
trans-unit.target: CaptureHdrPhotoAsync

trans-unit.source: **ConvertOrientationToPhotoOrientation** and **ReencodeAndSavePhotoAsync** are helper methods that are discussed as part of the basic media capture scenario in the article [Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md).
trans-unit.target: **ConvertOrientationToPhotoOrientation** and **ReencodeAndSavePhotoAsync** are helper methods that are discussed as part of the basic media capture scenario in the article [Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md).

trans-unit.source: Get optional reference frame
trans-unit.target: Get optional reference frame

trans-unit.source: The HDR process captures multiple frames and then composites them into a single image after all of the frames have been captured.
trans-unit.target: The HDR process captures multiple frames and then composites them into a single image after all of the frames have been captured.

trans-unit.source: You can get access to a frame after it is captured but before the entire HDR process is complete by handling the [**OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181392) event.
trans-unit.target: You can get access to a frame after it is captured but before the entire HDR process is complete by handling the [**OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181392) event.

trans-unit.source: You don't need to do this if you are only interested in the final HDR photo result.
trans-unit.target: You don't need to do this if you are only interested in the final HDR photo result.

trans-unit.source: **Important** [**OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181392) is not raised on devices that support hardware HDR and therefore do not generate reference frames.
trans-unit.target: **Important** [**OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181392) is not raised on devices that support hardware HDR and therefore do not generate reference frames.

trans-unit.source: Your app should handle the case where this event is not raised.
trans-unit.target: Your app should handle the case where this event is not raised.

trans-unit.source: Because the reference frame arrives out of context of the call to **CaptureAsync**, a mechanism is provided to pass context information to the **OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured** handler.
trans-unit.target: Because the reference frame arrives out of context of the call to **CaptureAsync**, a mechanism is provided to pass context information to the **OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured** handler.

trans-unit.source: First you should an object that will contain your context information.
trans-unit.target: First you should an object that will contain your context information.

trans-unit.source: The name and contents of this object is up to you.
trans-unit.target: The name and contents of this object is up to you.

trans-unit.source: This example defines an object that has members to track the file name and camera orientation of the capture.
trans-unit.target: This example defines an object that has members to track the file name and camera orientation of the capture.

trans-unit.source: AdvancedCaptureContext
trans-unit.target: AdvancedCaptureContext

trans-unit.source: Create a new instance of your context object, populate its members, and then pass it into the overload of [**CaptureAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181388) that accepts an object as a parameter.
trans-unit.target: Create a new instance of your context object, populate its members, and then pass it into the overload of [**CaptureAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181388) that accepts an object as a parameter.

trans-unit.source: CaptureWithContext
trans-unit.target: CaptureWithContext

trans-unit.source: In the [**OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181392) event handler, cast the [**Context**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181405) property of the [**OptionalReferencePhotoCapturedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181404) object to your context object class.
trans-unit.target: In the [**OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181392) event handler, cast the [**Context**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181405) property of the [**OptionalReferencePhotoCapturedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181404) object to your context object class.

trans-unit.source: This example modifies the file name to distinguish the reference frame image from the final HDR image and then calls the **ReencodeAndSavePhotoAsync** helper method to save the image.
trans-unit.target: This example modifies the file name to distinguish the reference frame image from the final HDR image and then calls the **ReencodeAndSavePhotoAsync** helper method to save the image.

trans-unit.source: OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured
trans-unit.target: OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured

trans-unit.source: Receive a notification when all frames have been captured
trans-unit.target: Receive a notification when all frames have been captured

trans-unit.source: The HDR photo capture has two steps.
trans-unit.target: The HDR photo capture has two steps.

trans-unit.source: First, multiple frames are captured, and then the frames are processed into the final HDR image.
trans-unit.target: First, multiple frames are captured, and then the frames are processed into the final HDR image.

trans-unit.source: You can't initiate another capture while the source HDR frames are still being captured, but you can initiate a capture after all of the frames have been captured but before the HDR post-processing is complete.
trans-unit.target: You can't initiate another capture while the source HDR frames are still being captured, but you can initiate a capture after all of the frames have been captured but before the HDR post-processing is complete.

trans-unit.source: The [**AllPhotosCaptured**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181387) event is raised when the HDR captures are complete, letting you know that you can initiate another capture.
trans-unit.target: The [**AllPhotosCaptured**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181387) event is raised when the HDR captures are complete, letting you know that you can initiate another capture.

trans-unit.source: A typical scenario is to disable your UI's capture button when HDR capture begins and then reenable it when **AllPhotosCaptured** is raised.
trans-unit.target: A typical scenario is to disable your UI's capture button when HDR capture begins and then reenable it when **AllPhotosCaptured** is raised.

trans-unit.source: AllPhotosCaptured
trans-unit.target: AllPhotosCaptured

trans-unit.source: Clean up the AdvancedPhotoCapture object
trans-unit.target: Clean up the AdvancedPhotoCapture object

trans-unit.source: When your app is done capturing, before disposing of the **MediaCapture** object, you should shut down the [**AdvancedPhotoCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181386) object by calling [**FinishAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181391) and setting your member variable to null.
trans-unit.target: When your app is done capturing, before disposing of the **MediaCapture** object, you should shut down the [**AdvancedPhotoCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181386) object by calling [**FinishAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181391) and setting your member variable to null.

trans-unit.source: CleanUpAdvancedPhotoCapture
trans-unit.target: CleanUpAdvancedPhotoCapture
